content: The following lists events that happened during **1987 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Wee Kim Wee](/wiki/Wee_Kim_Wee) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 14 January – The [Mandarin Oriental Singapore](/wiki/Mandarin_Oriental_Singapore) is officially opened. - 24 January – The last [nightsoil](/wiki/Nightsoil) bucket system is phased out in [Lorong Halus](/wiki/Lorong_Halus), signalling the beginning of complete modern [sanitation](/wiki/Sanitation) in Singapore. ### March - 1 March – A new [Have Three or More (if you can afford it)](/wiki/Population_planning_in_Singapore#Have-Three-or-More_(if_you_can_afford_it)) policy is announced to encourage people to have three or more children. This comes after significant decreases in population through the previous 'Stop at Two' policy of 1972. - 6 March – The [National Solidarity Party](/wiki/National_Solidarity_Party_(Singapore)) is formed. ### April - 3 April – The [Housing and Development Board](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) (HDB) introduces a new scheme for families with third children to upgrade to bigger flats. This comes after the new 'Have Three or More (if you can afford it)' policy is announced a month ago. ### May - 3 May – The first [vertical marathon](/wiki/Tower_running) is held at [Westin Stamford](/wiki/Westin_Stamford) to raise funds for [Community Chest](/wiki/The_Community_Chest_of_Singapore). - 9 May – The [Bukit Timah Satellite Earth Station](/wiki/Bukit_Timah_Satellite_Earth_Station) is officially opened. - 15 May – The [PSA Building](/wiki/PSA_Building) is officially opened, serving as [PSA's](/wiki/PSA_International) headquarters. - 21 May – 21 people are arrested in [Operation Spectrum](/wiki/Operation_Spectrum) for the [Marxist](/wiki/Marxist) conspiracy. ### June - 20 June – As part of [Operation Spectrum](/wiki/Operation_Spectrum), another 6 are detained, with 4 of the 16 arrested earlier released from detention. ### July - 11 July – Construction starts on [Changi Airport's](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) new Terminal 2, which will be linked to Terminal 1 via an [automated people mover](/wiki/Automated_people_mover) (now known as [Changi Airport Skytrain](/wiki/Changi_Airport_Skytrain)). ### August - 6 August – [SMRT Corporation](/wiki/SMRT_Corporation) is formed. - 14 August – The [Public Transport Council](/wiki/Public_Transport_Council) is formed to regulate public transport fares and standards. - 26 August – The [Van Kleef Aquarium](/wiki/Van_Kleef_Aquarium) reopens after an 18-month revamp. ### September - 2 September – The [cleanup of the Singapore River](/wiki/Singapore_River#Pollution_and_cleanup) was declared complete. - 28 September – The $1 and 1-cent [Second Series Coins](/wiki/Singapore_dollar#Coins) are launched. ### November - 7 November – The initial section of the [MRT](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)), between [Yio Chu Kang](/wiki/Yio_Chu_Kang_MRT_station) and [Toa Payoh](/wiki/Toa_Payoh_MRT_station), was opened. - 28 November – The Environment Building is officially opened as the Ministry of the Environment's (now [Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment](/wiki/Ministry_of_Sustainability_and_the_Environment)) headquarters, bringing together all of ENV's departments under one roof. ### December - 10 December – The Omniplanetarium (present-day [Omni-Theatre](/wiki/Omni-Theatre,_Science_Centre_Singapore)) is officially opened. - 12 December – The second section of the [MRT](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) was opened, stretching from [Novena](/wiki/Novena_MRT_station) to [Outram Park](/wiki/Outram_Park_MRT_station). - 28 December – [Singapore Indoor Stadium](/wiki/Singapore_Indoor_Stadium) starts construction. When completed, it will help to enhance sports and entertainment events, which is completed in 1989. ## Births - 22 January – [Daphne Khoo](/wiki/Daphne_Khoo), singer, contestant of [*Singapore Idol* (Season 1)](/wiki/Singapore_Idol#Season_1_(2004)). - 12 March – [Maxi Lim](/wiki/Maxi_Lim), actor. - 18 May – [Ya Hui](/wiki/Ya_Hui), actress - 6 August – [Sezairi Sezali](/wiki/Sezairi_Sezali), singer, winner of [*Singapore Idol* (Season 3)](/wiki/Singapore_Idol#Season_3_(2009)). - 5 October – [Desmond Ng](/wiki/Desmond_Ng), singer-actor - 11 October – [Wang Weiliang](/wiki/Wang_Weiliang), actor. - [Louis Chua](/wiki/Louis_Chua) – politician. ## Deaths - 16 November – [Zubir Said](/wiki/Zubir_Said), composer of "[Majulah Singapura](/wiki/Majulah_Singapura)" (b. 1907). - 17 November – [Lim Nang Seng](/wiki/Lim_Nang_Seng), sculptor (b. 1917). - 28 November – [Goh Choo San](/wiki/Goh_Choo_San), choreographer, ballet dancer (b. 1948). - *The MRT Story*. Singapore: Mass Rapid Transit Corporation. 1988. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-00-0251-0. This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1987 in Singapore
